*div1 type="summary"* *p*John M. McCalla to Austin, Lexington, Ky., October 6, 1829. Henry Clay, the evil genius of Kentucky. Andrew Jackson.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Lexington */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="10-06-1829">October 6th 1829*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*My dear friend.*/p*
*p*Just *date_mentioned n="10-xx-1828">one year ago */date_mentioned*you wrote me a letter from *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, by *person_mentioned*Mr Gregg,*/person_mentioned* and now by the same gentleman I send a reply. I shall be glad to renew and to perpetuate our old friendship, which on my part, I assure you is undiminished. I never recall the happy days of boyhood, but you appear in the list of remembered *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned*, and many scenes which we enjoyed together are among the " greenest spots " in my recollections. Our female friends *person_mentioned*Eliza */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Paulina*/person_mentioned*, for whom we both had pretty strong penchants, I see occasionally, but that *location_mentioned*little " paradise "*/location_mentioned* in which we were both sometimes admitted, is grown up with weeds, and its *person_mentioned*fair inhabitants*/person_mentioned* transplanted to other scenes, and surrounded by other objects. The first you know married *person_mentioned*Thos A Marshall*/person_mentioned*. She lives in *location_mentioned*Bourbon county*/location_mentioned*, has 6 or 7 *person_mentioned*children*/person_mentioned*, breeds like a rabbit, and looks almost as well as ever. *person_mentioned*Paulina */person_mentioned*was married to *person_mentioned*Brooks */person_mentioned*who died and she remained some years a *person_mentioned*widow*/person_mentioned*, and *date_mentioned n="04-xx-1828">18 months since*/date_mentioned* married a second time, to *person_mentioned*Capt. Maurice Langhorne*/person_mentioned* who now keeps a *location_mentioned*large house of entertainment*/location_mentioned* at *location_mentioned*Louisville*/location_mentioned*. I saw her last week, she does not look so well as formerly, in consequence of a spell of fever. She is however pretty much the same, especially the tone of voice, and her lively agreable manner. *person_mentioned*Mrs January */person_mentioned*is still living, also her sister *person_mentioned*Sally (Mrs Todd)*/person_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Jas. B January*/person_mentioned* is barely living being much reduced by excessive intemperance. *person_mentioned*Mrs Todd*/person_mentioned* has a large *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Will O Butler*/person_mentioned*, who married *person_mentioned*Levi Todds sister*/person_mentioned*, has no children. *person_mentioned*Nannette Price*/person_mentioned* who married *person_mentioned*Tom Smith*/person_mentioned* is also laughed at as childless, altho her *person_mentioned*husband */person_mentioned*is pretty generally blamed for it. I have heard several jokes against *person_mentioned*Smith */person_mentioned*coming from *person_mentioned*Mr Clay*/person_mentioned* and the *person_mentioned*ladies of the family*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr Clay*/person_mentioned* is now here with his *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*. He is in my opinion, the *person_mentioned*evil genius of *location_mentioned*Kentucky*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*. He set in motion all the springs of discord, and keeps society in a continual excitement. He appeared as *person_mentioned*counsel */person_mentioned*at the trial [of] *person_mentioned*Wickliffe's son*/person_mentioned* for the murder of the *person_mentioned*editor of the Gazette,*/person_mentioned* and volunteered on the occasion, and has not appeared in any other case before or since. He has been lately on trip to the *location_mentioned*lower part of this state*/location_mentioned* making speeches at dinner parties and keeping all his engines in motion against *person_mentioned*Genl Jackson*/person_mentioned*. As for the *person_mentioned*President*/person_mentioned*, he goes on as he has always heretofore done, attentive to his duty, and making all under him do their duty. His health has been somewhat injured by confinement but a visit to the seashore restored his health, and he is now progressing rapidly in the reform of the abuses which existed in the administration. It is melancholy fact, that great abases had grown up, and many who wore the front of honesty were guilty of great dishonesty and peculation. Party spirit still runs high, and the growlings of the storm are still heard although its main fury was exausted in the late election, *person_mentioned*Genl Jackson*/person_mentioned*, if he lives, will be re-elected as *person_mentioned*President*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I am sorry to pereieve that *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*is again exposed to *location_mentioned*foreign*/location_mentioned* war as well as intestine divisions. We are all anxious to purchase *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*from *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*, and the subject is beginning to excite a great deal of warm discussion in our public prints. If *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*will dispose of it on reasonable terms, I believe our *person_mentioned*government */person_mentioned*will no doubt be glad to obtain it, and I am sure it will meet the almost universal desire of our *person_mentioned*citizens*/person_mentioned*. The consequences to the *person_mentioned*holders of property*/person_mentioned* in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*would be very important, and it would promote the happiness and prosperity of all the *person_mentioned*citizens */person_mentioned*of the *location_mentioned*province*/location_mentioned*. A great many *person_mentioned*citizens of *location_mentioned*Kentucky*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* would move to your *location_mentioned*settlement*/location_mentioned* instantly, if it were under our government.*/p*
*p*In relation to your last and most important particular, to wit the *person_mentioned*widow*/person_mentioned*, I can safely say that if you will come on here, and plead your own cause I can point out to you both *person_mentioned*maids */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*widows*/person_mentioned*, who would make your heart go pit apat, and who would doubtless be willing to emigrate to any part of the known *location_mentioned*world */location_mentioned*with clever fellows. Only let me know that you will pay us a visit and I will arrange matters and things so far as, that if you can be satisfied with beauty, good temper, and affectionate dispositions, you shall have a fair opportunity to lay siege forthwith. I should indeed be truly glad to see you here once more, and to shew you my four *person_mentioned*children*/person_mentioned*, my *person_mentioned*eldest */person_mentioned*a boy going on thirteen years of age, and my *person_mentioned*youngest */person_mentioned*a girl (I have two of each) about 13 months old. Two of them are talking to me and playing round me and far as their prattle can go, disturbing me.*/p*
*p*Wishing you that success and prosperity, which your interprize and industry so well deserve, I am as "in auld lang syne' Your affectionate friend*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jn° M. McCalla*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin Esqr*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
